effect.Name: Oscillation (Switch)
effect.description: This effect ripples the texture like the backgrounds in the SNES game EarthBound.
effect.author: Foxioo

parameter.name: /* Foxioo Oscillation (Switch) Shader | 1.0 (20.09.2025) */
parameter.description: This effect ripples the texture like the backgrounds in the SNES game EarthBound.

parameter.name: Position X
parameter.description: A variable that determines the position of the texture in the X axis.

parameter.name: Position Y
parameter.description: A variable that determines the position of the texture in the Y axis.

parameter.name: ( Rotation )
parameter.description: Here are the variables for changing the rotation in the texture.

parameter.name: Rotation X
parameter.description: A variable that determines rotation.

parameter.name: ( Points )
parameter.description: Here are the variables for changing the position of point.

parameter.name: Point X
parameter.description: A variable that determines point position in the X axis.

parameter.name: Point Y
parameter.description: A variable that determines point position in the Y axis.

parameter.name: Scale
parameter.description: This variable determines the overall scale of the texture (in X and Y axes).

parameter.name: Scale X
parameter.description: This variable determines the scale of the texture in the X axis.

parameter.name: Scale Y
parameter.description: This variable determines the scale of the texture in the Y axis.

parameter.name: Looping Mode!
parameter.description: This variable determines how the texture is to be looped: 0 - REPEAT (Repeats the texture image); 1 - MIRRORED REPEAT (Repeats the texture image, but reflects the image at each repetition); 2 - CLAMP TO EDGE (Extends the texture after crossing coordinates 0 and 1); 3 - CLAMP TO BORDER (After crossing coordinates 0 and 1, the texture will be invisible). For more information, visit: https://learnopengl.com/Getting-started/Textures

parameter.name: Blending Mode
parameter.description: This variable determines what the base should be. Setting it to 1 sets the base as the texture of the object on which the effect is applied, and setting it to 0 sets this as the background.

parameter.name: Mixing
parameter.description: This variable sets the intensity of base visibility.

parameter.name: X
parameter.description: Enables/disables ripple for the X-Axis

parameter.name: Frequency X-Axis
parameter.description: This variable defines the frequency for the X axis.

parameter.name: Time Position X-Axis
parameter.description: This variable defines the time position for the sine wave on the X axis.

parameter.name: Amplitude X-Axis
parameter.description: This variable defines the amplitude for the X axis.

parameter.name: Y
parameter.description: Enables/disables ripple for the Y-Axis

parameter.name: Frequency Y-Axis
parameter.description: This variable defines the frequency for the Y axis.

parameter.name: Time Position Y-Axis
parameter.description: This variable defines the time position for the sine wave on the Y axis.

parameter.name: Amplitude X-Axis
parameter.description: This variable defines the amplitude for the Y axis.

parameter.name: ( Compatibility )
parameter.description: Here you will find options that have changed, but you can still achieve the previous effect.

parameter.name: Is Fusion Version Older Than 296?
parameter.description: (Only applies to Android and iOS!) This variable determines whether to use the newer background formatting. In Clickteam Fusion 2.5 for build 295.10 and earlier, the background texture was flipped along the Y axis, but this was changed in build 296.1. Check this option if you are using an older build!
